reviews.review_msg: I took Aynsley twice now and she never fails to disappoint. She answers questions well, provides lecture notes (not on BB though so you have to participate class) and her papers are easy. The only thing is that her exams are a big challenging, even if it's an intro course so be prepared to study a lot. Otherwise, she's super understanding and nice.

Aynsley cares so much for her students. She's extremely responsive to outreach for help. The course I took with her was pretty heavy, with a lot of information you need to retain. Her tests are extensive so you should prioritize studying. 

Quite frankly one of the kindest professors I've ever had.

She is a great professor overall and really nice and gave us an opportunity to get extra credit. But I will say she is hard marker on our papers and her exams are very written question heavy (written portion was worth 65/110). There was a lot of material to study for and I was exhausted after her final exam. 
Midterm was worth 20%. Final was 30%.

one of the best prof at Douglas, I did 2 course with her. she is the best prof. easy to talk with. if you attend her lectures and make notes carefully you will pass the course with good grade. gives great and helpful feedback on exams and assignments.

I had Aynsley this semester at Douglas College and she was the kindest person I've ever met. She cares so much about her students and goes above and beyond to help if needed. She is extremely knowledgeable so lectures are quite extensive but helpful. Do not hesitate to take her class! She is absolutely amazing!!

Aynsley is amazing. She gives students everything they need to know in order to be successful. she holds brief lectures before every big assignment/test and records/uploads every other lecture. so easy to approach and soso kind. definitely take her :)

Aynsley is amazing! I go to douglas and shes my prof rn, the sem has barely started and shes already the sweetest prof I've had. she cares deeply about her students doing well and the material is quite easy. she has a very kind heart, all good things to say :) definitely take a class with her, you wont regret it!

Really good lecturer. Her exams (non-cumulative) are very fair if you took decent notes and read the main textbook. She doesn't post her slides but she does post video lectures. The second textbook was kind of dumb (not tested other than in online quizzes and discussed in tutorial), but other than that, it was a really good / easy class.

A bad class. Gives to much info when she talks. Goes off topic in lecture but tests on that stuff not mandatory book or slides she shows but refuses to give copies of. It was like a cross web class with online quizzes from a useless second expensive book that she didn't use besides quizzes not even on exams but still had lectures and tutorials.
Hardest prof I've had at SFU. Tough grading, boring assignments, and not a helpful prof. Also tells jokes that she thinks are funny and tries to be relatable, but is actually rude IMO.

I can honestly say that Aynsley was one of the best profs I've had. She is young so she understands how to communicate with her students, and she makes lectures super interesting to go to! Also is a semi easy marker. She is super friendly and doesn't make you nervous when you need to ask her something! LOVE her

Awesome prof who is approachable, passionate, and informative. Despite not posting lecture slides, lectures were amazing- don't skip because you'll miss out. Bring a laptop to class to type notes. Readings are interesting/simple- reading before class will make it easier to take notes. One group project but clear criteria. Awesome prof!!

Aynsley was awesome! I am truly disappointed that I no longer have any classes left I can take with her. Engaging, personable, funny, and super nice. Lots of info to know but lectures are great and she is very specific and notes what will for sure be on exams. Does not post lectures. While group projects suck... the topic was fun. Takes attendance.

Goes way off of slides provided during lecture. Provides the bear minimum in her slides which makes them utterly useless. Important parts are only verbal. Get ready for your hand to cramp if you take notes! She takes attendance EVERY class. Not a fun class. She literally has never cracked a smile and comes off as unapproachable.

Aynsley was an amazing prof! She relies heavily on class participation and attendance  and marks you on it as well.  Her lectures are fast paced, but incredibly informative and well laid out. She was always on time and super organized which was definitely appreciated. I would absolutely take her again for crim!

She's really great. Amazing lectures and online modules are pretty easy except when it comes to the tests. They were straightforward but the TA's marked pretty hard. Like ridiculously hard. Overall, the prof is great and would recommend if you don't want to be bored out of your mind. Remember to write notes because she doesn't post them up.

Such a great professor. Even though the study material is hard and can be boring sometimes, she made the lecture and engaging. A very energetic professor who is available for questions anytime you want. Very easy marker, as long as you write something on the paper, she will give you some marks, so don't leave blanks even the short answer questions.
she's the reason why i even made an account. as long as you listen and write down good notes then you'll be fine!! if you're not into law then don't take it
Phenomenal professor. So kind and funny. Test questions are straight from the lecture  slides but she does not post these slides online. Easy A if you show up to class.

Aynsley is kind, funny, and approachable. No, she doesn't post her notes online, but this is actually a blessing in disguise, because then you're forced to take lots of notes (highly recommend bringing a laptop, unless you enjoy carpal tunnel) and pay attention, so you really learn! I'm not a crim student, but I would recommend Aynsley to anyone :)

I really enjoyed the class! You have to work though, she doesn't post her notes and her exams have written portions that you need to study for. The lectures are great! The online module quizzes, don't forget to watch your deadlines
Tough course, but such a sweet teacher who really wants to help you.

Aynsley is nice and really helpful! The exams weren't too easy, but they're manageable (go to lectures!). The online tutorials were fairly easy marks, so do the tutorial readings even though they won't be tested on exams. Lectures were interesting and she'll occasionally pause for question-taking to make sure everyone's clear and on the same page.
Ansley is good peoples. Warm and caring about students.

Not the easiest of professors but honestly the best professor I have ever met. What made her stand out was how engaging and energetic she was teaching the class. She is very positively responsive to participation and discussion (it's also mandatory), which is necessary because her slides can be a bit dry.

Lectures are interesting and participation matters. She gives you every opportunity to improve your grade and will give your credit if you do the homework.  Take notes on the videos. Exams are not hard if you pay attention to her lectures.

Awesome prof. She is very nice and always willing  to help. She is very clear about her expectations and encourages the success of her students. Lectures are great overall except she doesn't post the lecture slides online which sucks but it's for your own good. Exams and marking are fair, just need to attend class and do the readings.
Aynsley is amazing! By far the best prof Ive had so far at SFU. She was a wonderful lecturer, however her exams were on the tough side. Definitely recommend!
Funny and hella cool. I got of profs this term. Approachable. Take her if you can.
Aynsley is amazing, she is very clear in her lectures and wants you to do well ,With many opportunities to do so.

Aynsley taught be at Douglas College for Introduction to Criminal Justice System. Her lectures were informative, slides had sufficient information and you can tell that she is very interested in her field.

Aynsley is a nice prof and clear when speaking and instructing. She could improve on her powerpoints. She doesn't post them online so you need to be there to take them but they're very vague. Ofc adlib your notes but you can't catch everything bc she lacks an engaging presence or way of presenting the material. BUT final not cumulative!
Pescitelli is good but sometimes not helpful. Super strict guidelines and didnt like my paper even though i put alot of effort in.

Her lectures were amazing! Easy to follow, summarizes the main ideas and she encourages questions and discussions during them. Do not hesitate to ask her questions as she is always willing to help. Her midterm was fair; if you read through the stuff she mentioned during review, you should get an A+ no problem. She's the best prof I have ever had.

Aynsley is a great prof, she's always welcoming questions for clarification. She encourages us to use office hours. She doesn't post slides online because she says students learn better by taking their own notes, so always attend lectures. Had some interesting guest speakers this term, she's definitely a prof I'd love to have again.
One of the best professors ever, cares about students and offers help at any time. Can't be more thankful for such a great and caring prof

I have had a terrible time in this course. I've had trouble with the syllabus not matching up with the materials online. I completed an assignment on time, only to be told 2 days later by the TA that I had done it all wrong, and should refer to my syllabus (where it said nothing about this particular assignment). I'm not impressed.
She is by far the best prof I have ever had.. She made going to class so worth it and reminded me of why I am majoring in Criminology. AMAZING!

The reason why I created an account here in the first place. Definitely the best prof I have ever known. Exams and papers are definitive in their marking and more concept focused than route memorization. She makes questions and comments warmly encouraged during class and gives her all to see students do well. Couldn't ask for anything more.
BEST PROF EVER! TAKE ANY CRIM CLASS WITH HER. SHE WANTS YOU TO DO WELL
One of my favourite profs at SFU. Extremely kind, helpful, and approachable. Exams are fair. Term paper was fair. Would definitely recommend.
